moduleGroup.name: Local Shape Analysis With Study Module
moduleGroup.description: Compares per-vertex attributes of two groups. The attributes are radial distance and displacement feature.

module.name: Update Design Matrix
module.description: # takes as input a design matrix of the following format # column 1: unique identifier # column 2: filename # columns 3 through N: optional variables # also takes as input a list of new filenames that will substitute the existing values in column 2 of the design matrix # outputs a new design matrix with the new filenames in column 2 # assumes that the input design matrix has a header row, has space-separated values, and writes the output design matrix in the same way

input.name: Original Design Matrix
input.description: The columns in this design matrix are space-separated and follow this convention: # column 1: unique identifier # column 2: filename # columns 3 through N: optional variables

output.name: Updated Design Matrix
output.description: The updated design matrix that is output by this module.

input.name: List of Generated Files
input.description: A list of files that should be substituted into the original design matrix. Note that you need to have the same number of files here as there are rows in the original design matrix. Not only that, but the files need to be in the same order as they were in the original design matrix.

module.name: ShapeTranslator
module.description: This converts an arbitrary ShapeTools-compatible shape to any compatible format supported by this utility. Currently, no attributes are explicitly handled. In other words, only vertices and polygons are guaranteed to be translated, and whether colors, normals or data attributes are translated depends on the compatiblity of the reprsentations in ShapeTools. If the output format requires triangular polygons, any larger polygons in the input shape will be split into triangles.

input.name: Jar
input.description: The application jar path

input.name: -overwrite
input.description: Enables file overwriting

input.name: -debug
input.description: Enables additional error reporting

input.name: -input
input.description: Used to specify the input shape

input.name: -remove_attributes
input.description: Specifies that all attributes should be removed. This can be useful for debugging issues caused by attribute handling.

input.name: -dfs
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'DFS/Duff'. Sets the output type to DFS (Duff). The default is CCB BM

input.name: -off
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'OFF'. Sets the output type to OFF. The default is CCB BM

input.name: -m
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'CCB BM'. Sets the output type to CCB Brain Mapping Mesh (M). The default is CCB BM

input.name: -obj
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'MNI Ascii Polygon OBJ'. Sets the output type to MNI Ascii Polygon Object (Obj). The default is CCB BM

input.name: -dx
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'DX Mesh'. Sets the output type to Open DX. The default is CCB BM

input.name: -ply
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'PLY'. Sets the output type to PLY. The default is CCB BM

input.name: -fsb
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'FSB'. Sets the output type to triangle binary FreeSurfer. The default is CCB BM

input.name: -fsa
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'FSA'. Sets the output type to triangle ascii FreeSurfer. The default is CCB BM

input.name: -vtk
input.description: Specifies the output format to be 'VTK'. Sets the output type to ascii polygon vtk. The default is CCB BM

output.name: -output
output.description: Used to specify the output curve list filename

input.name: -help
input.description: Prints help and usage information.

input.name: -version
input.description: Prints version number of this application.

input.name: -verbose
input.description: Enables detailed status messages.

input.name: -license
input.description: Prints license details, and exits.

input.name: -twiki
input.description: Writes command line arguments as a TWiki format table to output and exit.

module.name: Shape Attribute
module.description:
Adds a list of scalar values to a shape, as a per vertex attribute.
This program may be used to associate a table of numbers with the vertices of a shape. A typical use would be to set the value of the "4d" attribute of a UCF file, given a list of the '4d" values.

input.name: Jar
input.description: Application_Jar

input.name: -verbose
input.description: Enable verbose statement.

input.name: -skipHeader
input.description: Causes the first line to be skipped

input.name: -skipColumn
input.description: Causes a column to be skipped. Indices start at 0.

input.name: -shape
input.description: A file containing a reference shape whose attribute will be set by a table of values. samples.

input.name: -sequence
input.description: Add or replace an attribute of a vertex with a number series.

input.name: -table
input.description: A file containing a table of values that will set the values of a Shape's vertex attribute samples.

output.name: -output
output.description: Specify output file path

input.name: -attrName
input.description: Sets the name of output file's attrubute.

input.name: -overwrite
input.description: Enables overwriting the output file, if it exists.

input.name: -dxout
input.description: A flag to set output file type as DX file type.

input.name: -plyAscii
input.description: Sets the output file type to PLY ASCII

input.name: -inputDelimiter
input.description: Sets the character that separates adjacent input value. Defaults to tab.

input.name: -examples
input.description: Prints examples of common usage.

input.name: -help
input.description: Prints help and usage information.

input.name: -version
input.description: Prints version number of this application.

input.name: -license
input.description: Prints license details, and exits.

input.name: -twiki
input.description: Writes command line arguments as a TWiki format table to output and exit.

input.description: DataType = 1,2,3,4,5 (for byte, short unsigned int, short signed int, float or int data, respectively)

module.name: Shape Attribute
module.description:
Adds a list of scalar values to a shape, as a per vertex attribute.
This program may be used to associate a table of numbers with the vertices of a shape. A typical use would be to set the value of the "4d" attribute of a UCF file, given a list of the '4d" values.

module.name: Update Design Matrix
module.description: # takes as input a design matrix of the following format # column 1: unique identifier # column 2: filename # columns 3 through N: optional variables # also takes as input a list of new filenames that will substitute the existing values in column 2 of the design matrix # outputs a new design matrix with the new filenames in column 2 # assumes that the input design matrix has a header row, has space-separated values, and writes the output design matrix in the same way

input.name: Original Design Matrix
input.description: The columns in this design matrix are space-separated and follow this convention: # column 1: unique identifier # column 2: filename # columns 3 through N: optional variables

output.name: Updated Design Matrix
output.description: The updated design matrix that is output by this module.

input.name: List of Generated Files
input.description: A list of files that should be substituted into the original design matrix. Note that you need to have the same number of files here as there are rows in the original design matrix. Not only that, but the files need to be in the same order as they were in the original design matrix.

module.name: 3D B-spline Deformation
module.description:
Peforms multi-modality B-spline based registration between a pair of 3D images.
The BSplineDeformableTransform is designed to be used for solving deformable registration problems. This transform is equivalent to generation a deformation field where a deformation vector is assigned to every point in space. The deformation vectors are computed using BSpline interpolation from the deformation values of points located in a coarse grid, that is usually referred to as the BSpline grid.

output.description: Specifies the output difference image after registration.

output.name: Difference Before
output.description: Specifies the output difference image before registration.

output.name: Deformation Field
output.description: Specifies the output deformation field file.

module.name: SSMA
module.description:
SSMA - Skull Stripping Meta Algorithm
[ FOR INTERNAL TESTING PURPOSE ONLY @ UCLA LONI ]

output.name: out
output.description: skull stripped output file in analyze format.

input.name: in
input.description: input file: non skull stripped analyze formated file

input.name: ref
input.description:
reference file in analyze format.
It is used to obtain the optimal output from SSMA. Typically, it is a ICBM skull stripped image or AZ ICBM atlas, which is available from UCLA LONI website.

module.name: Bias Field Corrector
module.description: Bias Field Corrector: Computes local estimates of gain variation in the iimage using an adaptive partial volume tissue model. Uses the estimates to compute a tri-cubic B-spline. Corrects the extracted barin image using values of the spline

module.name: FLIRT (nii.gz)
module.description: FLIRT (FMRIB's Linear Image Registration Tool) is a fully automated robust and accurate tool for linear (affine) intra- and inter-modal brain image registration.

citations.citation:
S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-219, 2004
PMID: 15501092

input.name: Input
input.description: Specifies the input volume file path.

input.name: Reference
input.description: Specifies the input reference image.

output.name: Output
output.description: Specifies the output volume file path.

input.name: Initial Matrix File
input.description: Specifies the Input 4x4 affine matrix - autodetects format ascii/medx. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

output.name: Output Matrix File
output.description: Outputs the matrix in 4x4 ascii format. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

input.name: Datatype
input.description: Forces the output to one of the following data types: char, short, int, float, double.

input.name: Cost
input.description: Specifies the intensity based cost function. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Search Cost
input.description: Specifies the type of search cost. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Angle Rep
input.description: Specifies the type of angle rep. Options are: {quaternion,euler} (default is euler)

input.name: Interpolation
input.description: Specifies the type of final interpolation. Options are: trilinear, nearestneighbour, sinc. (Default is trilinear)

input.name: Sinc Width
input.description: Specifies the full sinc width in voxels. (Default is 7)

input.name: Bins
input.description: Specifies the number of histogram bins. (Default is 256)

input.name: Transform Degrees of Freedom
input.description:
Specifies the number of degrees of freedom. (Default is 12)
Note: Choose from 6,7,9 or 12 Degrees of Freedom (DOF) for full 3D registrations. Also includes a 3DOF 2D-to-2D registration mode which is selected using the -2D option. Note that it does not perform any search in 2D mode, and cannot deal with 2D to 3D registrations. More flexible DOF options are provided by the specific schedule files provided in $FSLDIR/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: No Sampling
input.description: Do not change input sampling.

input.name: Force Scaling
input.description: Forces rescaling even for low-res images.

input.name: Min Sampling
input.description: Sets minimum voxel dimension for sampling (in mm).

input.name: Apply XFM
input.description: Applies transform (no optimization). (Requires -init option)

input.name: Apply XFM with Isotropic Resample
input.description: As applyxfm but forces isotropic resampling. Must specify <scale>.

input.name: Padding Size
input.description: Interpolates outside image by size (in voxels). (Requires -applyxfm option)

input.name: Search X
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for x-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Y
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for y-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Z
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for z-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: No Search
input.description: Sets all angular search ranges to 0 0. (Sets 0 0 for -searchrx, -searchry and -searchrz)

input.name: Coarse Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 60)

input.name: Fine Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 18)

input.name: Schedule
input.description:
Schedule file specifies what transformations/DOF are allowed and how the optimisation is performed. Must specify <schedule-file>. (Replaces default schedule)
Note: Several other schedule files could be used - including 3D translation only schedules, etc. These are all stored in ${FSLDIR}/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Reference Weight
input.description: Use weights for reference volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Input Weight
input.description: Use weights for input volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: 2D
input.description: Use 2D rigid body mode. (Ignores -dof option)

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Specifies level of verboseness. (0 is least and default)

input.name: Pause
input.description: Enables pause at each stage of transformation.

input.name: Sinc Window
input.description: Specifies the type of sinc window. Options are: rectangular, hanning, blackman.

input.name: Version
input.description: Prints the version information and exit

input.name: Help
input.description: Prints help information and exit.

module.name: Brain Parser
module.description:
Usage: [-p structure] [-r testing] [source file] [target file] [-m path to the models] [-n number of structures] [-t number of iterations] [-s smoothness]
-p 0: segmenting sub-cortical structures 1: sulci detection 2: segmenting structures using a contextual model -r 0: perform segmentation/detection 1: perform training [source file]: in testing, it points to the source file in training, it points directory in which the training volumes are saved [target file]: in testing, it points to the target file in training, it points directory in which the trained classifiers are saved -m : directory of trained models -n : number of structures (only effective in training) -t : number of iterations (default value 3, for '-r 1', it is the number of auto-context classifiers) -s : smoothness factor (defalut=0.5, typical 0.0~2.0)

input.name: Structure
input.description: 0: segmentation sub-cortical structures 1: sulci detection

input.name: Testing
input.description: 0: perform segmentation/detection 1: perform training

input.name: Source File
input.description: In testing, it points to the source file in training, it points directory in which the training volumes are saved.

output.name: Target File
output.description: In testing, it points to the target file in training, it points directory in which the trained classifiers are saved.

input.name: Models Directory
input.description: Directory of trained models.

input.name: Number of Structures
input.description: Only effective in training.

input.name: Smoothness Factor
input.description: Defalut=0.5, typical 0.0~2.0.

module.name: Convert XFM (nii.gz)
module.description:
Usage: convert_xfm [options] <input-matrix-filename> e.g. convert_xfm -omat <outmat> -inverse <inmat> convert_xfm -omat <outmat_AtoC> -concat <mat_BtoC> <mat_AtoB>
convert_xfm -ref <refvol> -in <invol> -omedx <medxmat> <flirtmat>
Available options are: -ref <refvol> (no default) -in <inputvol> (no default) -omat <matrix-filename> (4x4 ascii format) -omedx <matrix-filename> (MEDx format) -xfmtype {a,m,u,g,s,t} (Specify MEDx xfm format) a,m = AlignLinearReslice (default) u = UserTransformation g = GenericReslice s = ShadowTransform t = IntoTalairachSpace -concat <second-matrix-filename> -fixscaleskew <second-matrix-filename> -middlevol <intermediary-volume-filename> -inverse (Reference image must be the one originally used) -matonly (Use no volumes or MEDx support - default) -help

module.name: FLIRT (nii.gz)
module.description: FLIRT (FMRIB's Linear Image Registration Tool) is a fully automated robust and accurate tool for linear (affine) intra- and inter-modal brain image registration.

citations.citation:
S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-219, 2004
PMID: 15501092

input.name: Input
input.description: Specifies the input volume file path.

input.name: Reference
input.description: Specifies the input reference image.

output.name: Output
output.description: Specifies the output volume file path.

input.name: Initial Matrix File
input.description: Specifies the Input 4x4 affine matrix - autodetects format ascii/medx. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

output.name: Output Matrix File
output.description: Outputs the matrix in 4x4 ascii format. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

input.name: Datatype
input.description: Forces the output to one of the following data types: char, short, int, float, double.

input.name: Cost
input.description: Specifies the intensity based cost function. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Search Cost
input.description: Specifies the type of search cost. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Angle Rep
input.description: Specifies the type of angle rep. Options are: {quaternion,euler} (default is euler)

input.name: Interpolation
input.description: Specifies the type of final interpolation. Options are: trilinear, nearestneighbour, sinc. (Default is trilinear)

input.name: Sinc Width
input.description: Specifies the full sinc width in voxels. (Default is 7)

input.name: Bins
input.description: Specifies the number of histogram bins. (Default is 256)

input.name: Transform Degrees of Freedom
input.description:
Specifies the number of degrees of freedom. (Default is 12)
Note: Choose from 6,7,9 or 12 Degrees of Freedom (DOF) for full 3D registrations. Also includes a 3DOF 2D-to-2D registration mode which is selected using the -2D option. Note that it does not perform any search in 2D mode, and cannot deal with 2D to 3D registrations. More flexible DOF options are provided by the specific schedule files provided in $FSLDIR/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: No Sampling
input.description: Do not change input sampling.

input.name: Force Scaling
input.description: Forces rescaling even for low-res images.

input.name: Min Sampling
input.description: Sets minimum voxel dimension for sampling (in mm).

input.name: Apply XFM
input.description: Applies transform (no optimization). (Requires -init option)

input.name: Apply XFM with Isotropic Resample
input.description: As applyxfm but forces isotropic resampling. Must specify <scale>.

input.name: Padding Size
input.description: Interpolates outside image by size (in voxels). (Requires -applyxfm option)

input.name: Search X
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for x-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Y
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for y-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Z
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for z-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: No Search
input.description: Sets all angular search ranges to 0 0. (Sets 0 0 for -searchrx, -searchry and -searchrz)

input.name: Coarse Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 60)

input.name: Fine Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 18)

input.name: Schedule
input.description:
Schedule file specifies what transformations/DOF are allowed and how the optimisation is performed. Must specify <schedule-file>. (Replaces default schedule)
Note: Several other schedule files could be used - including 3D translation only schedules, etc. These are all stored in ${FSLDIR}/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Reference Weight
input.description: Use weights for reference volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Input Weight
input.description: Use weights for input volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: 2D
input.description: Use 2D rigid body mode. (Ignores -dof option)

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Specifies level of verboseness. (0 is least and default)

input.name: Pause
input.description: Enables pause at each stage of transformation.

input.name: Sinc Window
input.description: Specifies the type of sinc window. Options are: rectangular, hanning, blackman.

input.name: Version
input.description: Prints the version information and exit

input.name: Help
input.description: Prints help information and exit.

module.name: Reorient (8-bit)
module.description:
Rotates volumes by 90 or 180 degrees and / or mirrors them along the major axes. This allows gross prealignment of volumes so that automated registration has a reasonable chance of success.
This program can also be used as a null operation that converts an input volume into the default output format specified during the compilation of the AIR package.

citations.citation: Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Holmes, C.J., Cherry, S.R., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998a). Automated image registration: I. General methods and intrasubject, intramodality validation. J Comput Assist Tomogr V22, 139-152. PMID: 9448779

Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Watson, J.D., Sicotte, N.L., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998b). Automated image registration: II. Intersubject validation of linear and nonlinear models. J Comput Assist Tomogr 22, 153-165. PMID: 9448780

module.name: 3D B-spline Deformation
module.description:
Peforms multi-modality B-spline based registration between a pair of 3D images.
The BSplineDeformableTransform is designed to be used for solving deformable registration problems. This transform is equivalent to generation a deformation field where a deformation vector is assigned to every point in space. The deformation vectors are computed using BSpline interpolation from the deformation values of points located in a coarse grid, that is usually referred to as the BSpline grid.

output.description: Specifies the output difference image before registration.

module.name: SSMA
module.description:
SSMA - Skull Stripping Meta Algorithm
[ FOR INTERNAL TESTING PURPOSE ONLY @ UCLA LONI ]

output.name: out
output.description: skull stripped output file in analyze format.

input.name: in
input.description: input file: non skull stripped analyze formated file

input.name: ref
input.description:
reference file in analyze format.
It is used to obtain the optimal output from SSMA. Typically, it is a ICBM skull stripped image or AZ ICBM atlas, which is available from UCLA LONI website.

module.name: Bias Field Corrector
module.description: Bias Field Corrector: Computes local estimates of gain variation in the iimage using an adaptive partial volume tissue model. Uses the estimates to compute a tri-cubic B-spline. Corrects the extracted barin image using values of the spline

citations.citation: Shattuck DW, Sandor-Leahy SR, Schaper KA, Rottenberg DA, and Leahy RM, (2001) "Magnetic Resonance Image Tissue Classification Using a Partial Volume Model", Neuroimage 13(5):856-876 PMID: 11304082

input.name: Input File
input.description: The filename of the input MRI file in Analyze format.

output.name: Output File
output.description: The filename for the corrected file.

input.name: Mask File
input.description: mask the input image with the file <maskfile>

input.name: Histogram Radius
input.description: histogram radius (voxels) [default: 12]

input.name: Bias Sample Spacing
input.description: bias sample spacing (voxels) [default: 16]

input.name: Control Point Spacing
input.description: control point spacing (voxels) [default: 64]

input.name: Spline Stiffness Weighting
input.description: spline stiffness weighting parameter [default: 1e-04]

input.name: Minimum allowed bias estimate
input.description: Minimum allowed bias value (default 0.9)

input.name: Maximum allowed bias estimate
input.description: maximum allowed bias estimate (default 1.1)

output.name: Masked Bias Output
output.description: specify masked bias field estimate output path

input.name: Ellipse
input.description: use ellipsoid for ROI histogram

input.name: Block
input.description: Use block for ROI histogram

input.name: Iterative Mode
input.description: iterative mode (overrides all other settings)

input.name: Apply Correction Field
input.description: apply correction field to entire volume

input.name: Small Bias Model
input.description: small bias model [0.95,1.05]

input.name: Medium Bias Model
input.description: medium bias model [0.90,1.10]

input.name: High Bias Model
input.description: high bias model [0.80,1.20]

input.name: Verbosity
input.description: verbosity level (0=silent) [default: 1]

input.name: Show Timing
input.description: Display timing information

output.name: Bias Output
output.description: save bias field estimate

input.name: Bias Estimate Convergence threshold
input.description: bias estimate convergence threshold. (values > 0.1 disable) [default: 0]

module.name: FLIRT (nii.gz)
module.description: FLIRT (FMRIB's Linear Image Registration Tool) is a fully automated robust and accurate tool for linear (affine) intra- and inter-modal brain image registration.

citations.citation:
S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-219, 2004
PMID: 15501092

input.name: Input
input.description: Specifies the input volume file path.

input.name: Reference
input.description: Specifies the input reference image.

output.name: Output
output.description: Specifies the output volume file path.

input.name: Initial Matrix File
input.description: Specifies the Input 4x4 affine matrix - autodetects format ascii/medx. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

output.name: Output Matrix File
output.description: Outputs the matrix in 4x4 ascii format. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

input.name: Datatype
input.description: Forces the output to one of the following data types: char, short, int, float, double.

input.name: Cost
input.description: Specifies the intensity based cost function. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Search Cost
input.description: Specifies the type of search cost. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Angle Rep
input.description: Specifies the type of angle rep. Options are: {quaternion,euler} (default is euler)

input.name: Interpolation
input.description: Specifies the type of final interpolation. Options are: trilinear, nearestneighbour, sinc. (Default is trilinear)

input.name: Sinc Width
input.description: Specifies the full sinc width in voxels. (Default is 7)

input.name: Bins
input.description: Specifies the number of histogram bins. (Default is 256)

input.name: Transform Degrees of Freedom
input.description:
Specifies the number of degrees of freedom. (Default is 12)
Note: Choose from 6,7,9 or 12 Degrees of Freedom (DOF) for full 3D registrations. Also includes a 3DOF 2D-to-2D registration mode which is selected using the -2D option. Note that it does not perform any search in 2D mode, and cannot deal with 2D to 3D registrations. More flexible DOF options are provided by the specific schedule files provided in $FSLDIR/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: No Sampling
input.description: Do not change input sampling.

input.name: Force Scaling
input.description: Forces rescaling even for low-res images.

input.name: Min Sampling
input.description: Sets minimum voxel dimension for sampling (in mm).

input.name: Apply XFM
input.description: Applies transform (no optimization). (Requires -init option)

input.name: Apply XFM with Isotropic Resample
input.description: As applyxfm but forces isotropic resampling. Must specify <scale>.

input.name: Padding Size
input.description: Interpolates outside image by size (in voxels). (Requires -applyxfm option)

input.name: Search X
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for x-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Y
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for y-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Z
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for z-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: No Search
input.description: Sets all angular search ranges to 0 0. (Sets 0 0 for -searchrx, -searchry and -searchrz)

input.name: Coarse Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 60)

input.name: Fine Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 18)

input.name: Schedule
input.description:
Schedule file specifies what transformations/DOF are allowed and how the optimisation is performed. Must specify <schedule-file>. (Replaces default schedule)
Note: Several other schedule files could be used - including 3D translation only schedules, etc. These are all stored in ${FSLDIR}/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Reference Weight
input.description: Use weights for reference volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Input Weight
input.description: Use weights for input volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: 2D
input.description: Use 2D rigid body mode. (Ignores -dof option)

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Specifies level of verboseness. (0 is least and default)

input.name: Pause
input.description: Enables pause at each stage of transformation.

input.name: Sinc Window
input.description: Specifies the type of sinc window. Options are: rectangular, hanning, blackman.

input.name: Version
input.description: Prints the version information and exit

input.name: Help
input.description: Prints help information and exit.

module.name: Brain Parser
module.description:
Usage: [-p structure] [-r testing] [source file] [target file] [-m path to the models] [-n number of structures] [-t number of iterations] [-s smoothness]
-p 0: segmenting sub-cortical structures 1: sulci detection 2: segmenting structures using a contextual model -r 0: perform segmentation/detection 1: perform training [source file]: in testing, it points to the source file in training, it points directory in which the training volumes are saved [target file]: in testing, it points to the target file in training, it points directory in which the trained classifiers are saved -m : directory of trained models -n : number of structures (only effective in training) -t : number of iterations (default value 3, for '-r 1', it is the number of auto-context classifiers) -s : smoothness factor (defalut=0.5, typical 0.0~2.0)

input.name: Structure
input.description: 0: segmentation sub-cortical structures 1: sulci detection

input.name: Testing
input.description: 0: perform segmentation/detection 1: perform training

input.name: Source File
input.description: In testing, it points to the source file in training, it points directory in which the training volumes are saved.

output.name: Target File
output.description: In testing, it points to the target file in training, it points directory in which the trained classifiers are saved.

input.name: Models Directory
input.description: Directory of trained models.

input.name: Number of Structures
input.description: Only effective in training.

input.name: Smoothness Factor
input.description: Defalut=0.5, typical 0.0~2.0.

module.name: Convert XFM (nii.gz)
module.description:
Usage: convert_xfm [options] <input-matrix-filename> e.g. convert_xfm -omat <outmat> -inverse <inmat> convert_xfm -omat <outmat_AtoC> -concat <mat_BtoC> <mat_AtoB>
convert_xfm -ref <refvol> -in <invol> -omedx <medxmat> <flirtmat>
Available options are: -ref <refvol> (no default) -in <inputvol> (no default) -omat <matrix-filename> (4x4 ascii format) -omedx <matrix-filename> (MEDx format) -xfmtype {a,m,u,g,s,t} (Specify MEDx xfm format) a,m = AlignLinearReslice (default) u = UserTransformation g = GenericReslice s = ShadowTransform t = IntoTalairachSpace -concat <second-matrix-filename> -fixscaleskew <second-matrix-filename> -middlevol <intermediary-volume-filename> -inverse (Reference image must be the one originally used) -matonly (Use no volumes or MEDx support - default) -help

module.name: FSLCpGeom (nii.gz)
module.description: Copy certain parts of the header information (image dimensions, voxel dimensions, voxel dimensions units string, image orientation/origin or qform/sform info) from one image to another. Note that only copies from Analyze to Analyze or Nifti to Nifti will work properly. Copying from different files will result in loss of information or potentially incorrect settings.

input.description:
Specifies the number of degrees of freedom. (Default is 12)
Note: Choose from 6,7,9 or 12 Degrees of Freedom (DOF) for full 3D registrations. Also includes a 3DOF 2D-to-2D registration mode which is selected using the -2D option. Note that it does not perform any search in 2D mode, and cannot deal with 2D to 3D registrations. More flexible DOF options are provided by the specific schedule files provided in $FSLDIR/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: No Sampling
input.description: Do not change input sampling.

input.name: Force Scaling
input.description: Forces rescaling even for low-res images.

input.name: Min Sampling
input.description: Sets minimum voxel dimension for sampling (in mm).

input.name: Apply XFM
input.description: Applies transform (no optimization). (Requires -init option)

input.name: Apply XFM with Isotropic Resample
input.description: As applyxfm but forces isotropic resampling. Must specify <scale>.

input.name: Padding Size
input.description: Interpolates outside image by size (in voxels). (Requires -applyxfm option)

input.name: Search X
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for x-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Y
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for y-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Z
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for z-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: No Search
input.description: Sets all angular search ranges to 0 0. (Sets 0 0 for -searchrx, -searchry and -searchrz)

input.name: Coarse Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 60)

input.name: Fine Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 18)

input.name: Schedule
input.description:
Schedule file specifies what transformations/DOF are allowed and how the optimisation is performed. Must specify <schedule-file>. (Replaces default schedule)
Note: Several other schedule files could be used - including 3D translation only schedules, etc. These are all stored in ${FSLDIR}/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Reference Weight
input.description: Use weights for reference volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Input Weight
input.description: Use weights for input volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: 2D
input.description: Use 2D rigid body mode. (Ignores -dof option)

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Specifies level of verboseness. (0 is least and default)

input.name: Pause
input.description: Enables pause at each stage of transformation.

input.name: Sinc Window
input.description: Specifies the type of sinc window. Options are: rectangular, hanning, blackman.

input.name: Version
input.description: Prints the version information and exit

input.name: Help
input.description: Prints help information and exit.

module.name: Reorient (8-bit)
module.description:
Rotates volumes by 90 or 180 degrees and / or mirrors them along the major axes. This allows gross prealignment of volumes so that automated registration has a reasonable chance of success.
This program can also be used as a null operation that converts an input volume into the default output format specified during the compilation of the AIR package.

citations.citation: Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Holmes, C.J., Cherry, S.R., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998a). Automated image registration: I. General methods and intrasubject, intramodality validation. J Comput Assist Tomogr V22, 139-152. PMID: 9448779

Woods, R.P., Grafton, S.T., Watson, J.D., Sicotte, N.L., and Mazziotta, J.C. (1998b). Automated image registration: II. Intersubject validation of linear and nonlinear models. J Comput Assist Tomogr 22, 153-165. PMID: 9448780

module.name: TranslateTo
module.description:
TranslateTo provides an automatic file format translation service for file formats read by the ShapeToolsIO library. TranslateTo uses the file format properties descriptions and the ShapePreparer classes contained in the ShapeToolsIO library file readers and writsr to map common geometry file compoenents to an output file format, if supported by the output format.
Where possible, per-vertex attributes are written to the output format; however, because each output format varies in the number and data type of allowed per-vertex attributes, lossless copying of vertex attributes cannot be guaranteed.
Each file format writer is reqauired to supply the means to prepare an arbitary input Shape for writing; This may include creating requried components (e.g. vertex normals). Thus, TranslateTo is essenially a wrapper for the various ShapePreparer classes provided by the ShapeToolsIO library file format writers. The sophistication and completeness of the preparation process varies with the output file format.

input.description:
-crosscorloc - this restricts the search for best correspondence to a region in the rotation space around the default orientation. This is a good option to use if the data is already (very roughly) aligned. Most neuroimaging data fall into this category
-crosscor - the search is done globally over the whole rotation space. Presumes no initial alignment whatsoever
-foe - first order ellispoid,as in Syner & Gerig et al.
-foeloc - first order ellispoid,as in Syner & Gerig et al. with a local constraint. Probably closest thing to original FOE alignment

module.name: RigidQuaternionTransform
module.description:
Given two sets containing the same number of vertices, and a one to one mapping between these vertices, this program will:
* Find the rigid transform that, when applied to the first set of vertices, will minimize the total distance between the transformed coordinates of the first set of vertices and the homologous vertices of the second vertex set. * Write that transform as a homogenous transform matrix in format usable by programs at LONI, and elsewhere, to apply the coordinate transform so defined.
The input must specify two sets of homologous points. The points may specified as the vertices of a shape, which can be encoded in any ShapeTools library compatible format. The points are also allowed to be encoded in a human-readable ASCII format, where points are line-delimited and coordinates are space-delimited.
The rigid transform estimated by this program may be encoded as a 4x4 homogeneous coordinate transformation matrix. By default, this matrix is written to an ASCII file. Alternatively, the transformation may be encoded to a format compatible with the Landmark Warp Framework

input.description: Application_Jar

input.name: -overwrite
input.description: Enables file overwriting

input.name: -debug
input.description: Enables additional error reporting

input.name: -noCheck
input.description: Diables check for duplicate points

input.name: -lmw
input.description: Indicates that the output filetype should be a landmark warp file.

input.name: -inv
input.description: Indicates that the output transformation matrix should be inverted.

input.name: Reference
input.description: The reference shape

input.name: Target
input.description: The target shape

module.name: ShapeTranslator
module.description: This converts an arbitrary ShapeTools-compatible shape to any compatible format supported by this utility. Currently, no attributes are explicitly handled. In other words, only vertices and polygons are guaranteed to be translated, and whether colors, normals or data attributes are translated depends on the compatiblity of the reprsentations in ShapeTools. If the output format requires triangular polygons, any larger polygons in the input shape will be split into triangles.

input.name: local/global flag
input.description:
-crosscorloc - this restricts the search for best correspondence to a region in the rotation space around the default orientation. This is a good option to use if the data is already (very roughly) aligned. Most neuroimaging data fall into this category
-crosscor - the search is done globally over the whole rotation space. Presumes no initial alignment whatsoever
-foe - first order ellispoid,as in Syner & Gerig et al.
-foeloc - first order ellispoid,as in Syner & Gerig et al. with a local constraint. Probably closest thing to original FOE alignment

module.name: Volume Regression Analysis
module.description:
This module somputes the Multiple Linear Regression on volumetric data.
Responses are the VOLUME/IMAGE intensities at each voxel location.
Predictors/covariates are various subject demographic, clinical or phenotypic data (e.g., MMSE, CDR, Gender, etc.)
More information about this tool is available here:
http://wiki.stat.ucla.edu/socr/index.php/SOCR_EduMaterials_AnalysesCommandLineVolumeMultipleRegression

input.name: Design Matrix
input.description:
Enter Design Matrix. See the template here:
http://wiki.stat.ucla.edu/socr/index.php/SOCR_EduMaterials_AnalysesCommandLineVolumeMultipleRegression

input.name: Regressors Specification
input.description:
Regressor Specifications.
Regressors must be predictors/columns/covariates listed in the Design Matrix (see first argument)
Example: -regressors CDR MMSE

input.name: Header Flag
input.description:
Header Flag (-h).
Required for all Design Matrices.

input.name: Volume Dimensions
input.description:
Specify the Z Volume Dimension Orders is: (Z, Y, X):
Example: -dim 220 220 220
For 1D or 2D data, use 1 for the higher demensions.

output.name: Output P-values
output.description:
Specify the Output base-Filename for P-values (these are the p-values for each specified predictor).
Example: -p /ifs/tmp/P_Value
This base-filename will be appended automatically with covariate and suffix information as these files are written out to disc.

output.name: Output R-values
output.description:
Specify the Output base-Filename for R-values (these are the correlation/effects for each specified predictor).
Example: -r /ifs/tmp/R_Value
This base-filename will be appended automatically with covariate and suffix information as these files are written out to disc.

input.name: Data Type
input.description:
Specify the Input Data type:
Example: -data_type 2 -data_type [1,2,3,4]: Type=1 is for Byte, Type=2 is for Unsigned Short integer, Type=3 is for Signed Short Integer, and Type=4 is for 4Byte=Float Volume Input;

input.name: Mask File
input.description:
Enter an optional Mask File. It is used to restrict the voxel-based domain of the Regression Analysis.
If no Mask is specified all voxes are processed independently.
Example: -mask /ifs/adni/3T/PERMS/IVO/JACOBIANS/3T_bl_002_S_0413.img

output.name: Output T-stats
output.description:
Specify the Output base-Filename for the T-Stats output volumes.
Example: -t /ifs/tmp/T_stats
This base-filename will be appended automatically with covariate and suffix information as these files are written out to disc.

input.name: Byte-Swap Flag
input.description:
Toggle this flag on if you want the byte-swap on all of your input/output data. Enter: "-byteswap"
Default is no flag and no byte-swap.

input.name: Byte-Order
input.description: * big = BIG_ENDIAN processor * little = LITTLE_ENDIAN processor * other = default processor (java.nio.ByteOrder.nativeOrder())

input.name: Memory Allocation
input.description:
Value to pass to -mx parameter of java (JVM) executable.
Here are the details from the java man page: Specifies the maximum size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. This value must be a multiple of 1024 greater than 2 MB. Append the letter k or K to indicate kilobytes, the letter m or M to indi- cate megabytes, the letter g or G to indicate giga- bytes, or the letter t or T to indicate terabytes.

module.name: False Discovery Rate Correction
module.description:
This module applies False Discovery Error (FDR) correction to p-values fro both Shapes and volumes.
Shape data is entered as a list of p_values.
Volume data is intered as raw binary volumes.
Responses are the VOLUME/IMAGE intensities at each voxel location.
Predictors/covariates are various subject demographic, clinical or phenotypic data (e.g., MMSE, CDR, Gender, etc.)
More information about this tool is available here:
http://wiki.stat.ucla.edu/socr/index.php/SOCR_EduMaterials_AnalysesCommandLineFDR_Correction

input.name: Input Filename (raw P-values)
input.description: Enter the name of the raw p-values file (ASCII for shapes and binary for volumes)

input.name: Data Type
input.description: -type [0,1]: Type=0 is for ASCII text input file type, e.g., Shapes Type=1 is for binary 4Byte=Float Input file; e.g., 3D/4D volumes.

output.name: Output Filename (DFDR-corrected p-values)
output.description: Enter the filename for the FDR-corrected p-values

input.name: Byte-Order
input.description:
The byteorder string specified the I/O dta byte-order: string is one of {big, little, other}.
* big = BIG_ENDIAN processor * little = LITTLE_ENDIAN processor * other = default processor (java.nio.ByteOrder.nativeOrder())

input.name: Number of P-values
input.description:
Enter the number of p-values in the file -number integer
Example, if volume is 220^3, the number to enter is: 10648000

input.name: FDR Rate (q)
input.description: -fdr_rate [double]: the False Discovery Rate level (e.g., 0.05)

input.name: Dimensions
input.description: dimensions of the volume in this order (x,y,z)

input.name: Voxel Size
input.description: Enter voxel size for the volume (default is 1mm x 1mm x 1mm)

input.name: Memory Allocation
input.description:
Value to pass to -mx parameter of java (JVM) executable.
Here are the details from the java man page: Specifies the maximum size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. This value must be a multiple of 1024 greater than 2 MB. Append the letter k or K to indicate kilobytes, the letter m or M to indi- cate megabytes, the letter g or G to indicate giga- bytes, or the letter t or T to indicate terabytes.

module.name: Volume Regression Analysis
module.description:
This module somputes the Multiple Linear Regression on volumetric data.
Responses are the VOLUME/IMAGE intensities at each voxel location.
Predictors/covariates are various subject demographic, clinical or phenotypic data (e.g., MMSE, CDR, Gender, etc.)
More information about this tool is available here:
http://wiki.stat.ucla.edu/socr/index.php/SOCR_EduMaterials_AnalysesCommandLineVolumeMultipleRegression

input.name: Design Matrix
input.description:
Enter Design Matrix. See the template here:
http://wiki.stat.ucla.edu/socr/index.php/SOCR_EduMaterials_AnalysesCommandLineVolumeMultipleRegression

input.name: Regressors Specification
input.description:
Regressor Specifications.
Regressors must be predictors/columns/covariates listed in the Design Matrix (see first argument)
Example: -regressors CDR MMSE

input.name: Header Flag
input.description:
Header Flag (-h).
Required for all Design Matrices.

input.name: Volume Dimensions
input.description:
Specify the Z Volume Dimension Orders is: (Z, Y, X):
Example: -dim 220 220 220
For 1D or 2D data, use 1 for the higher demensions.

output.name: Output P-values
output.description:
Specify the Output base-Filename for P-values (these are the p-values for each specified predictor).
Example: -p /ifs/tmp/P_Value
This base-filename will be appended automatically with covariate and suffix information as these files are written out to disc.

output.name: Output R-values
output.description:
Specify the Output base-Filename for R-values (these are the correlation/effects for each specified predictor).
Example: -r /ifs/tmp/R_Value
This base-filename will be appended automatically with covariate and suffix information as these files are written out to disc.

input.name: Data Type
input.description:
Specify the Input Data type:
Example: -data_type 2 -data_type [1,2,3,4]: Type=1 is for Byte, Type=2 is for Unsigned Short integer, Type=3 is for Signed Short Integer, and Type=4 is for 4Byte=Float Volume Input;

input.name: Mask File
input.description:
Enter an optional Mask File. It is used to restrict the voxel-based domain of the Regression Analysis.
If no Mask is specified all voxes are processed independently.
Example: -mask /ifs/adni/3T/PERMS/IVO/JACOBIANS/3T_bl_002_S_0413.img

output.name: Output T-stats
output.description:
Specify the Output base-Filename for the T-Stats output volumes.
Example: -t /ifs/tmp/T_stats
This base-filename will be appended automatically with covariate and suffix information as these files are written out to disc.

input.name: Byte-Swap Flag
input.description:
Toggle this flag on if you want the byte-swap on all of your input/output data. Enter: "-byteswap"
Default is no flag and no byte-swap.

input.name: Byte-Order
input.description: * big = BIG_ENDIAN processor * little = LITTLE_ENDIAN processor * other = default processor (java.nio.ByteOrder.nativeOrder())

input.name: Memory Allocation
input.description:
Value to pass to -mx parameter of java (JVM) executable.
Here are the details from the java man page: Specifies the maximum size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. This value must be a multiple of 1024 greater than 2 MB. Append the letter k or K to indicate kilobytes, the letter m or M to indi- cate megabytes, the letter g or G to indicate giga- bytes, or the letter t or T to indicate terabytes.

module.name: False Discovery Rate Correction
module.description:
This module applies False Discovery Error (FDR) correction to p-values fro both Shapes and volumes.
Shape data is entered as a list of p_values.
Volume data is intered as raw binary volumes.
Responses are the VOLUME/IMAGE intensities at each voxel location.
Predictors/covariates are various subject demographic, clinical or phenotypic data (e.g., MMSE, CDR, Gender, etc.)
More information about this tool is available here:
http://wiki.stat.ucla.edu/socr/index.php/SOCR_EduMaterials_AnalysesCommandLineFDR_Correction

module.name: TranslateTo
module.description:
TranslateTo provides an automatic file format translation service for file formats read by the ShapeToolsIO library. TranslateTo uses the file format properties descriptions and the ShapePreparer classes contained in the ShapeToolsIO library file readers and writsr to map common geometry file compoenents to an output file format, if supported by the output format.
Where possible, per-vertex attributes are written to the output format; however, because each output format varies in the number and data type of allowed per-vertex attributes, lossless copying of vertex attributes cannot be guaranteed.
Each file format writer is reqauired to supply the means to prepare an arbitary input Shape for writing; This may include creating requried components (e.g. vertex normals). Thus, TranslateTo is essenially a wrapper for the various ShapePreparer classes provided by the ShapeToolsIO library file format writers. The sophistication and completeness of the preparation process varies with the output file format.

input.name: Jar
input.description: Application_Jar

input.name: -list
input.description: Lists supported file types.

input.name: -check
input.description: checks to see if translation is possible.

input.name: -o
input.description: Enables replacing of output file, if it already exists..

input.name: inputType
input.description: Input file type used to check whether translation is possible.

input.name: -type
input.description: Set output file type.

input.name: -input
input.description: input file

output.name: -output
output.description: output file

input.name: -triangulate
input.description: Attempt to triangulate surface before translations

input.name: -orient
input.description: Attempt to triangulate and consistently orient surface before translations

input.name: -options
input.description: Set format specific translation options

input.name: -canPrepareValue
input.description: String printed checking indicates a translation is possible.

input.name: -cannotPrepareValue
input.description: String printed checking indicates a translation is not possible.

input.name: -help
input.description: Prints help and usage information.

input.name: -version
input.description: Prints version number of this application.

input.name: -verbose
input.description: Enables detailed status messages.

input.name: -license
input.description: Prints license details, and exits.

input.name: -twiki
input.description: Writes command line arguments as a TWiki format table to output and exit.
